intro: Whitfordiodendron taiwanianum, commonly known as the Taiwan white-flowered tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its white to pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are elliptical in shape and have a glossy surface. It thrives in acidic soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially available.
